alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Converse County Lower Elevations; East Platte County; Niobrara County; North Laramie Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 20 at 2:52AM MST until February 22 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches expected. Locally higher amounts will be possible with narrow bands. Extremely dangerous wind chills as low as 40 degrees below zero. * WHERE...East central Wyoming and the northern Nebraska Panhandle including Douglas, Wheatland, Lusk, Harrison, and Chadron. * WHEN...5 AM MST Monday until 11 AM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous travel conditions possible due to icy, snow packed roads and reduced visibilities in falling and blowing snow. Extreme wind chills can result in frost bite on exposed skin in less than 5 minutes. Hypothermia can also develop quickly if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Converse County Lower Elevations; East Platte County; Niobrara County; North Laramie Range
